title: Naj-Dev Portfolio Website
description: A modern portfolio website showcasing my projects, skills, and experience, built using Next.js and other cutting-edge technologies.
achievements: Designed a visually appealing and responsive user interface.
Implemented a modular structure for scalability and reusability.
Showcased a dynamic project grid with support for embedded videos and images.
additionalNotes: This portfolio website reflects my growth as a developer, combining frontend and backend technologies in a cohesive manner. Future plans include integrating the T3 stack for backend support, implementing user interactions like comments and reactions, adding advanced animations, and leveraging server-side rendering for enhanced performance. It's a hub for all my projects and a platform for self-expression!

title: Breakout Simulation Labs
description: A multi-part lab series for creating and enhancing a Breakout game simulation, culminating in advanced skills like register management, assembly programming, and low-level memory operations.
achievements: Built a foundational game simulation in Lab 2 with single ball, paddle, and block mechanics.
Extended functionality in Lab 3 to support multiple objects, scoring, and linked list integration.
Developed custom linked list functions in Lab 4, including `insert`, `deleteSome`, `iterate`, and `sort`.
Implemented advanced memory management techniques to handle allocation failures gracefully.
Enhanced game mechanics with paddle deflection, bonus modes, and optimized output.
Gained expertise in assembly programming with register allocation, stack alignment, and efficient array operations from Lab 5.
Developed assembly functions to analyze audio data, track min/max values, and convert PCM to decibels.
additionalNotes: This project was developed progressively across Labs 2-5, introducing increasing complexity and refining both high-level and low-level programming skills. Concepts like function pointers, stack alignment, and register usage from Lab 5 provided a deeper understanding of performance optimization and system-level programming. Insights from Lab 6 on assembly-level optimization, including efficient register use and memory handling, provided foundational knowledge for further enhancements.

title: JP Morgan Chase Internship Project
description: Developed a new React frontend for an internal tool used by thousands of legal entities.
achievements: Collaborated with UX and product teams to deliver a microfrontend architecture.
Designed for 99% uptime to support developers maintaining critical services.
additionalNotes: Strong focus on communication and independent development.

title: Next.js Lightweight CMS
description: A lightweight CMS built with Next.js for dynamic content management, designed for portfolio projects and small-scale websites.

title: AI-Powered Playlist Generator
description: A machine learning project designed to analyze Last.fm data and generate 20-song playlists based on user preferences and song similarities.
achievements: Developed a pipeline to fetch and process user listening data from the Last.fm API.
Planned for AI-based song similarity analysis using OpenAI models.
Designed an intuitive interface for generating and exporting playlists.
additionalNotes: This project combines music analysis with machine learning to provide personalized playlist recommendations.

title: ECE 2360 Final Project
description: Temperature-activated lamp with RGB LED, LCD, and buzzer functionality.
achievements: Combined sensors and microcontroller programming to create a cohesive hardware project
Resolved hardware and software troubleshooting challenges
additionalNotes: Learned new hardware components and applied GitHub for collaboration.

title: Learning App - JPMorgan Chase Code for Good Hackathon
description: A web application designed to bridge the education gap by providing personalized learning paths and resources for underserved communities. The project leverages cutting-edge technology to make learning accessible and engaging.
achievements: Won the JPMorgan Chase Code for Good Hackathon 2024 for innovative use of technology.
Developed personalized learning paths using dynamic content generation.
Implemented a resource hub with real-time updates and user-friendly navigation.
additionalNotes: This project was created during an intense 24-hour hackathon, showcasing teamwork and innovative problem-solving under pressure. The application demonstrated the power of technology in addressing educational challenges and won accolades for its impact and technical execution.

title: XPS9570-Opencore-IntelWifi

Facilitated a seamless macOS experience on non-Apple hardware.
